intro: Tetractomia roxburghii, commonly known as the Himalayan spurge, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and temperate climates. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. Tetractomia roxburghii produces small, clustered flowers that are usually green or yellowish, with a unique cyathium structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family.
